a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Accumulated cyclone energy of North Atlantic hurricanes
Accumulated cyclone energy (ACE) is an index used to measure the activity of a cyclone/hurricane season. It
combines the number of hurricane systems, how long they existed and how intense they became. It is calculated
by squaring the maximum sustained surface wind in the system every six hours that the cyclone is a Named
Storm and summing it up for the season.
